Table1.News title: Californians at higher risk from COVID-19 are eligible for vaccination now
Table1.News content: If you have a medical condition or disability that increases your risk of getting sick with COVID-19, or live or work in high-risk settings, you can get vaccinated now. Find out how to see if youâ€™re eligible and make an appointment.

Table1.News title: California sets aside 40% of vaccine doses for most impacted communities
Table1.News content: The state seeks to reach 2 million vaccine doses administered in those communities, prioritizing them to safely and sustainably reopen our economy.

Table1.News title: California accelerating vaccinations for education and childcare workers
Table1.News content: The state will dedicate 10% of vaccines to K-12 school staff and childcare workers starting March 1. These workers will get special codes that let them schedule expedited appointments through myturn.ca.gov.
